results.adx_keywords: Classical Music;Tanglewood Music Festival (Lenox, Mass);Brain Cancer;Content Type: Personal Profile;Thomas, Michael Tilson;Boston Symphony Orchestra;New World Symphony
results.title: A Star Maestro, Fighting Brain Cancer, Finds Peace in Music
results.abstract: Michael Tilson Thomas, who returned to Tanglewood, where his career first took off, refuses to be confined by his illness.

media.caption: Michael Tilson Thomas rehearsing with the Boston Symphony Orchestra at Tanglewood on Saturday.

results.abstract: A once-scholarly discipline courts irrelevance in its desperate bid for relevance.

results.adx_keywords: Restaurants;Cooking and Cookbooks;Vegetarianism;Moosewood (Ithaca, NY, Restaurant);Ithaca (NY)
results.title: Moosewood, the Beloved Vegetarian Restaurant, Prepares for Its Second Act
results.abstract: The Ithaca, N.Y., destination was revolutionary because of its menu and its collective ownership model. Recently, the new owners hosted a dinner to celebrate its past and future.

media.caption: The dinner, which featured sweet pea hummus; baby beet salad; Orecchiette with pea shoots, carrots and French radishes; and chickpea stew with panisses, was served family style.

results.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Charlie Savage, Alan Feuer and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Documents at Mar-a-Lago Were Moved and Hidden as U.S. Sought Them, Filing Suggests
results.abstract: The filing by the Justice Department paints the clearest picture to date of its efforts to retrieve documents from the former president’s Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida.

media.caption: The Justice Department included a photo of documents seized from former President Donald J. Trump’s Florida home in its court filing.

results.adx_keywords: Hikes and Hiking;Wildfires;Global Warming;Travel and Vacations;Heat and Heat Waves;Pacific Crest Trail;California
results.byline: By Rowan Moore Gerety and Mason Trinca
results.title: Heat, Water, Fire: How Climate Change Is Transforming the Pacific Crest Trail
results.abstract: The already grueling 2,600-mile hike now includes the added challenges of global warming, which can mean a lack of shade and exposure to smoke and fire.

media.caption: Thru-hikers on the Pacific Crest Trail spend up to five months walking from Mexico to Canada — and the imprint of climate change is now felt along the entire route.

results.title: The Enduring Echoes of Moorish Spain
results.abstract: Exploring the country’s Arab influence is an impossibly romantic journey, involving palaces with intricate geometric designs, castles and grand mosques reconfigured by Christians into cathedrals.

media.caption: Córdoba’s Mosque-Cathedral, or La Mezquita, was one of the first and grandest mosques in Europe.

results.title: She Couldn’t Stand Still Without Pain. What Was Wrong?
results.abstract: Her legs felt heavy, as if her feet were encased in lead. A telltale sound was the key clue in diagnosing her rare disorder.

results.title: Mikhail S. Gorbachev, Reformist Soviet Leader, Is Dead at 91
results.abstract: Adopting principles of glasnost and perestroika, he weighed the legacy of seven decades of Communist rule and set a new course, presiding over the end of the Cold War and the dissolution of the U.S.S.R.

media.caption: Mikhail S. Gorbachev had a profound effect on his time: In little more than six tumultuous years, he lifted the Iron Curtain, transforming the map of Europe and the political climate of the world.
media.copyright: Fred R. Conrad/The New York Times

results.title: F.D.A. Authorizes Updated Covid Booster Shots Targeting Omicron Subvariants

results.title: The First A.P. African American Studies Class Is Coming This Fall
results.abstract: The new course will undergo a pilot program in 60 schools, as the debate over how to teach history becomes ever more divisive.

media.caption: The new A.P. course in African-American studies will include the civil rights movement. Here, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. leads marchers at the start of a five-day voting-rights march to Montgomery, Ala., in 1965.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Whales and Whaling;Animal Behavior;Animal Cognition;Royal Society Open Science (Journal)
results.title: Humpback Whales Pass Their Songs Across Oceans
results.abstract: Whales share songs from Australia to Ecuador, scientists have found, suggesting a remarkably fast cultural evolution.

media.caption: A humpback whale breaching in waters near Esmeraldas, Ecuador. Whales in Australia were found to be passing their songs to others in French Polynesia, which in turn gave songs to whales in Ecuador.

results.title: ‘The Best Tool We Have’ for Self-Harming and Suicidal Teens
results.abstract: Studies indicate that dialectical behavior therapy offers greater benefits than more generalized therapy. But treatment is intensive, and expensive.

media.caption: “There’s no medication for suicidal behavior,” said Michele Berk, a psychologist at Stanford University. “The patient needs to learn other behavioral skills that the medication does not teach you.”
media.copyright: Anastasiia Sapon for The New York Times

results.title: Paxlovid Cuts Covid Deaths Among Older People, Israeli Study Finds
results.abstract: Among patients under 65, however, the drug made little difference in hospitalization or death rates.

media.caption: According to the new Israeli study, the medication was highly effective when administered to individuals 65 and over.

results.title: ‘There’s Something in the Air’ in Italy’s Salento
results.abstract: In this southernmost region of the country’s bootheel, the Ionian Sea is to the west, the Adriatic to the east, and the countryside is filled with stone walls and twisted olive trees, fields of long golden grass and wildflowers.

media.caption: In the gardens of Convento di Santa Maria di Costantinopoli, a boutique hotel in the Salento.
